data.title: Blaenavon Industrial Landscape
data.text: Blaenavon Industrial Landscape in and around Blaenavon Torfaen Wales was inscribed a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 2000 The Blaenavon Ironworks now a museum was a major centre of iron production using locally mined or quarried iron ore coal and limestone Raw materials and products were transported via horse drawn tramroads canals and steam railways The Landscape includes protected or listed monuments of the industrial processes transport infrastructure workers housing and other aspects of early industrialisation in South Wales
